content.question: Several identical objects are initially at rest on a horizontal surface. The following figures are free-body diagrams for the forces that are exerted on the objects over a distance <math alttext="delta x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>â–µ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. In which of the diagrams is the net work being done on the object zero?

choices.label: The figure presents a free body diagram with three arrows of medium length extending from a common point. One arrow points vertically upwards, another arrow points vertically downwards, another arrow points horizontal to the right.

The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A medium arrow points vertically upwards, a long arrow points diagonally upwards and to the right, another medium arrow points vertically downwards, and another medium arrow points horizontally to the left.

The figure presents a free body diagram with three arrows extending from a common point. A medium arrow points vertically upwards, a long arrow points diagonally upwards and to the right, and a small arrow points vertically downwards.

The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A medium arrow points vertically upwards, a long arrow points diagonally upwards and to the right, another medium arrow points vertically downwards, and another long arrow points diagonally downwards and to the left.
All four free-body diagrams shown show a net force that would do work on the object.

content.answer: The figure presents a free body diagram with four arrows extending from a common point. A medium arrow points vertically upwards, a long arrow points diagonally upwards and to the right, another medium arrow points vertically downwards, and another long arrow points diagonally downwards and to the left.
